title: Rabia Shahzad bags gold in Hampshire Weightlifting Championship
text:
Pakistan’s female weightlifter Rabia Shahzad grabbed gold medal at the Hampshire weight lifting championship in 49-kilogrammes category.

The 21-year-old competed in the event – featuring nine weightlifters around the World where she lifted 40kg in snatch and 52kg in clean and jerk to capture the top spot.

A day earlier, Rabia claimed the silver medal in the 49-kilogram female category in the Welsh Open Weightlifting Championships.

Rabia took to Twitter to share her victory, she wrote, “Gold clinched in Hampshire Weightlifting Championship 2019 Alhumdulillah”

The veteran all-rounder Shoaib Malik congratulates the young champion on making the country proud.

“Congrats @rabiashahzadwl well done, we are all so proud of you 👍🏽 #ibleedgreen 🇵🇰,” Malik tweeted.

Congrats @rabiashahzadwl well done, we are all so proud of you 👍🏽 #ibleedgreen 🇵🇰 https://t.co/SJ88P2dYW1 — Shoaib Malik 🇵🇰 (@realshoaibmalik) October 14, 2019
